cont.entity_a: Router had good range. Offers a strong signal and fast speed across a large area.
cont.entity_b: Router's range is less than expected. Router resolves dead spots better than previous models.

cont.entity_a: Serious incompatibility problems with certain devices.
cont.entity_b: Setup wizard is incompatible with Windows XP.

Connection.comm: Router loses connectivity frequently and requires resetting.

cont.entity_a: Experienced intermittent connection issues with various devices. Router drops connections frequently, requiring power cycling to resolve. Frequent connection drops despite firmware updates.
cont.entity_b: Router occasionally crashes and requires multiple reboots. Wireless N devices fail to connect. Router requires frequent reboots to maintain wireless connectivity.

cont.entity_a: Initial setup was difficult but resolved with Linksys tech support and a firmware update.
cont.entity_b: Router is easy to set up but has a poor wireless range.

cont.entity_a: Linksys tech support was helpful for setup and troubleshooting.
Performance was initially satisfactory but degraded after a year.
Firmware updates are necessary to address connection drops. Router's firmware is buggy and lacks third-party firmware support.
cont.entity_b: Router supports DD-WRT software, offering additional features. Router functions well with DD-WRT firmware but still has limitations. Router's firmware has serious issues with NAT and wireless connection stability.

cont.entity_a: Router is sensitive to power surges.

cont.entity_b: Router's USB storage feature is limited and unreliable. Router lacks support for NTFS formatted drives. Router's documentation for storage link feature is inadequate.
Router is a good option for tech-savvy users with DD-WRT firmware.
